page.title: 04A SPECIAL SCHOOL IN HESSLE
page.content: Bridgeview residential school, built in 1978, accommodates disruptive children between 8 - 16 years from schools throughout Humberside. There are 57 boys and 8 girls there. The school has a residential and educational block with kitchens, laundry and recreation areas. There are 10 teachers, several residential care officers and a social worker. The care officers sleep in the bedroom areas with the children. Children are sent to the school only after all other discipline has failed. There are physically violent children, very withdrawn, physically handicapped and diabetic pupils.They can be sent to Bridgeview for 9 months up to 6 years. They can go home fortnightly. The children are taken on outings, youth hostelling and camping.Inside the school they have a tuck shop.
